formatedText.text: Mr. Fogg will use his note-book to record interesting facts and details about the journey around the world.
One cannot travel without the necessary means. Money will help us solve many problems that may arise during the long trip.
One will never get lost with this accurate compass. It will always show us the right direction.
Mr. Fogg's globe shows our route as well as our location day by day.
When one only has 80 days to make the tour around the world, time is most precious. We must always know how much is left.
This is Mr. Fogg's personalized flask that he always has with him. The contents thereof remain a mystery.
A set of binoculars is an important tool that allows taking a closer look at something in the distance. We will definitely have a lot to see during our trip.
A ship cannot stop without an anchor. It will be carried away by the wind and the current.
It can be chilly and windy at sea. Keep all the portholes in your cabin closed or an illness is inevitable.
The captain must always keep an eye on the mariner's compass, thus ensuring the safe navigation of his ship.
A ship's bell is used to sound the time on board ship and is also practical in foggy weather.
Without a sand glass the crew will not be able to watch the time and remain on course.
At night the deck should be lit brightly or it may be very dangerous to go upon.
A lifebuoy is used to rescue a person fallen overboard. Hopefully, there will not be a need to use it on this voyage.
The captain uses the telescope to sight the coastline and passing vessels. Without one, the ship is blind.
Can there be a ship without a wheel? It is absolutely impossible to navigate the vessel without it.
This sacred ring was worn by all the pharaohs of Egypt. It was passed on from one generation to the next and was a symbol of the pharaohs' divine nature.
Lotus is a sacred flower of the Egyptians, a symbol of beauty, purity and creation.
The famous Egyptian ruler Cleopatra loved to look in her mirror and admire her own fascinating beauty.
The Golden Ankh is a symbol of eternal life and the rising sun. It is believed that wearing this amulet extends your life and secures entry into the Kingdom of the Dead after death.
Egyptian pharaohs used such golden jugs to pour water for washing.
This is the golden necklace of the powerful queen Nefertiti, the "Mistress of Happiness", as Egyptians called her.
The Scarab Amulet was sacred to the Egyptians and symbolized rebirth. They also believed it would bring good luck in military affairs.
The golden statue of the Egyptian Goddess Bast represented as a cat is a symbol of joy, happiness and love.
The crown of Egyptian pharaohs is a symbol of power and divine nature of the person wearing it.
This beautiful vase was found in the tomb of the most famous Egyptian pharaoh Tutankhamun.
This figurine symbolizes the unification of cobra and vulture, the sacred creatures of Upper and Lower Egypt.
The depiction of the sun decorated with precious gems was the symbol of absolute and eternal truth.
An ancient oil lamp decorated with precious gems is not used nowadays, but can be a great gift.
Ganesha is a four-armed elephant-headed Hindu god, the deva of intellect and wisdom.
The cow is a sacred animal in India, the symbol of abundance, the sanctity of all life and of the earth.
In ancient India lotus was symbolic of divinity, creative powers and fertility.
The elephant is a revered animal in India. The white elephant which brought the good news of Buddha's birth became the symbol of liberation from the bonds of the world.
This bottle of extremely rare incense is a unique piece of art of the Indian perfumers, perfect in its every detail.
A golden peacock's feather with gems will be a perfect decoration for the turban of any rajah.
The Hamsa hand jeweled pendant is a symbol of unity and luck.
This is a stylized pictograph of Om, the most sacred sound for Indians. They believe this symbol brings good luck and helps maintain mental and emotional calmness.
A gorgeous golden bracelet with emeralds is a perfect jewelry accessory that will satisfy even the most demanding tastes.
"That which wind creates on a day that hot is." A traditional Chinese paper fan decorated with national ornaments will save you on a hot and windless day.
"That which tirelessly pleases our ear with singing." A mechanical nightingale will sing until it runs down.
"That which from the burning sun saves." A Chinese paper umbrella will not save you from rain, but is the best protection from the scorching sun.
"A mysterious vessel that the living power holds." The brown Yixing clay teapot is used to brew tea, the traditional Chinese drink.
"That which from misfortunes protects." The Chinese believe that the tortoise statue keeps you protected from all external negative powers.
"That which luck on a long journey brings." The carp is the sacred fish in China symbolizing strength and success.
"The one who will protect the home from uninvited guests." An angry lion is a Chinese statuette believed to protect from uninvited guests that is traditionally placed in front of the house.
"That which light on a pitch-dark night gives." A Chinese paper lantern is usually hung outside of the house and is believed to bring prosperity and luck.
"The old wise dragon that by the sparkle of its scales blinds." The dragon is a Chinese mythical creature symbolizing power and prosperity.
"The symbol of unity of all things." This is a medallion with the ancient Chinese symbol -- Yin and Yang -- a symbol of unity of two opposites.
"The message of our ancestors on a thin papyrus." Traditional Chinese landscape paintings on rice paper are symbolic of long and happy life.
This is a game board for traditional Japanese chess Shogi, one of the most popular board games in the land.
A geisha is a traditional Japanese female performer entertaining guests with dancing and signing as well as serving tea.
Vases are one of the most popular interior decorations in Japan. They are usually placed in special niches on low stands or tables.
You will find a gong in every Japanese shrine. Any person entering the shrine has to strike the gong.
Such masks of the Japanese traditional Noh drama are real masterpieces of Japanese art.
Japanese women preferred hair ornaments to jewelry. Hair combs reflected the tastes and likings of their owners.
The miniature sculpture of Hotei, one of the seven gods of happiness, the happy god of abundance and good health.
Kites are traditional Japanese entertainment. They are made for different holidays and celebrations.
This dwarf tree planted in a small pot is the major decoration of Japanese houses and gardens.
The Japanese fan is also called a sun fan as it looks like the sun with its beams coming from the center.
The gold coin of happiness is a symbol of power and might of five Japanese emperors.
This kanji symbol means love and happiness and also brings harmony and understanding in marriage.
This is a gold coin from ancient treasures. According to legend, such coins can bring you to the place where they were found.
Pirates wile away the time playing the dice game in their long sea campaigns.
With a cutlass like that, a pirate fears nothing. A reliable weapon will always get him out of trouble.
Wherever a pirate ends up this sundial will always indicate apparent solar time in any place on earth.
You can drink rum or decorate your cabin with this gorgeous, ornate cup.
The pipe is a must have for any pirate. Among other things it makes him look more menacing.
Each pirate ship should be equipped with cannons that can pierce any deck armor.
The skull is believed to be a sign of death and destruction. It was used as a warning not to mess with pirates; otherwise no life would be spared.
Unfortunately, this large chest is empty. However if you decide to bury your treasure, you will have a proper container for it.
This old map shows where the immense pirate treasure is hidden. No one has yet checked whether it is there or not.
If there is no powder on board, there is no use for cannons. You will not be able to fire without good powder.
If a pirate starts missing the sea after a long time away from it, he can listen to the sounds of the breaking waves coming out of this exotic shell.
These are golden rings for Mr. Fogg and Aouda’s wedding.
